remarks: The quotient structure of a ring is a ring.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
statement:
qusring2.u $e |- ( ph -> U = ( R /s .~ ) ) $.
qusring2.v $e |- ( ph -> V = ( Base ` R ) ) $.
qusring2.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` R ) $.
qusring2.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
qusring2.o $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` R ) $.
qusring2.r $e |- ( ph -> .~ Er V ) $.
qusring2.e1 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( a .~ p /\ b .~ q ) -> ( a .+ b ) .~ ( p .+ q ) ) ) $.
qusring2.e2 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( a .~ p /\ b .~ q ) -> ( a .x. b ) .~ ( p .x. q ) ) ) $.
qusring2.x $e |- ( ph -> R e. Ring ) $.
qusring2 $p |- ( ph -> ( U e. Ring /\ [ .1. ] .~ = ( 1r ` U ) ) ) $.
$d .+ p q $.
$d .1. p q $.
$d .x. p q $.
$d .~ a b p q $.
$d R p q $.
$d U a b p q $.
$d V a b p q $.
$d a b p ph q $.
